availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lewis Triplett (Adair County, Kentucky, dentist and inventor.)

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, inventor. Kentucky native. Married to Francis A. Murrel Triplett in Adair County, Kentucky on November 29, 1844. Father of Eugene Triplett, John F. Triplett, Laura Triplett, James Triplett, Mattie Triplett, Nannie Triplett, and Minney Triplett. Saddler in Adair County in 1850. Dentist in Adair County in 1860. Received U.S. Patent Number 45,361 for the Triplett & Scott repeater carbine on December 6, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 1, p. 26B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 1, p. 131.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Adair County Marriages, Film #000469187.
Executive Documents Printed by Order of The House of Representatives during the Second Session of the Thirty-Eighth Congress, 1864-65, vol. 10-11 (Washington: Government Printing Office, 1865), p. 961.
Find A Grave, "Lewis Triplett (1822-1902)," Memorial #89233558, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/89233558 (accessed December 17, 2019).
